dcterms:creator: Emilio Calvano
Giacomo Calzolari
Vincenzo Denicol`o
Sergio Pastorello
dcterms:description: This dataset examines the role of Q-learning automata in enabling collusion or cooperation in dynamic environments, particularly in oligopoly settings.
dcterms:title: Calvano et al. [2020]

dcterms:creator: Martino Banchio
Giacomo Mantegazza
dcterms:description: This dataset explores adaptive algorithms and their potential for collusion through coupling in various game settings.
dcterms:title: Banchio and Mantegazza [2022]

dcterms:creator: Olivier Compte
Andrew Postlewaite
dcterms:description: This dataset provides insights into plausible cooperation in repeated games, focusing on the dynamics of cooperation and defection.
dcterms:title: Compte and Postlewaite [2015]

dcterms:creator: Olivier Compte
Andrew Postlewaite
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses ignorance and uncertainty in the context of repeated games, contributing to the understanding of cooperation dynamics.
dcterms:title: Compte and Postlewaite [2018]

dcterms:creator: Timo Klein
dcterms:description: This dataset investigates autonomous algorithmic collusion through Q-learning in sequential pricing environments.
dcterms:title: Klein [2021]

dcterms:creator: Dilip Abreu
David Pearce
Ennio Stacchetti
dcterms:description: This dataset presents a theory of discounted repeated games with imperfect monitoring, focusing on cooperation dynamics.
dcterms:title: Abreu et al. [1990]

dcterms:creator: Drew Fudenberg
Eric Maskin
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses the folk theorem in repeated games with discounting or incomplete information, contributing to the understanding of cooperation.
dcterms:title: Fudenberg and Maskin [1986]

dcterms:creator: Drew Fudenberg
David Levine
Eric Maskin
dcterms:description: This dataset explores the folk theorem with imperfect public information, enhancing the understanding of cooperation in games.
dcterms:title: Fudenberg et al. [1994]

dcterms:creator: Wolfram Barfuss
Richard P. Mann
dcterms:description: This dataset models the effects of environmental and perceptual uncertainty using deterministic reinforcement learning dynamics.
dcterms:title: Barfuss and Mann [2022]

dcterms:creator: Satinder P. Singh
Tommi Jaakkola
Michael I. Jordan
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses learning without state-estimation in partially observable Markovian decision processes.
dcterms:title: Singh et al. [1994]
